intro: Notylia punoensis, commonly known as the Puno notylia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in cloud forests at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
